hints_html:
A cumulative distribution function F of a continuous random variable must satisfy the following:

  • \(\lim_{x\to -\infty} F(x) = 0\)

  • \(\lim_{x\to +\infty} F(x) = 1\)

  • F is continuous

  • F is non-decreasing

hints_raw:
A cumulative distribution function ''F'' of a continuous random variable must satisfy the following:

* <math>\lim_{x\to -\infty} F(x) = 0</math>
* <math>\lim_{x\to +\infty} F(x) = 1</math>
* ''F'' is continuous
* ''F'' is non-decreasing
question: 4 (a)
sols_html:
Following the definition of a cdf (see the hint), we compute

  • \(\lim_{x \rightarrow -\infty} F(x) = a\) so \(a = 0\)

and

  • \(\lim_{x \rightarrow \infty} F(x) = b\) so \(b=1\).

  • To impose continuity at \(x=1\), we need \(\lim_{x \rightarrow 1} F(x) = F(1) = b = 1\). Obviously \(\lim_{x \rightarrow 1^+} F(x) = 1\). So looking at the left limit will give us k:

\[\begin{aligned} \lim_{x \rightarrow 1^-} F(x) = \lim_{x \rightarrow 1^-} k \arctan x = k \arctan 1\end{aligned}\]

Therefore k = 1/(arctan 1)”, or simply \(k = \frac4{\pi}\).

  • Since arctan is non-decreasing, so is F.

Hence our final answer is

\(a=0,\quad b=1,\quad k = \frac{4}{\pi}.\)
sols_raw:
Following the definition of a cdf (see the hint), we compute

* <math>\lim_{x \rightarrow -\infty} F(x) = a</math> so <math>a = 0</math>

and

* <math>\lim_{x \rightarrow \infty} F(x) = b</math> so <math>b=1</math>.

* To impose continuity at <math>x=1</math>, we need <math>\lim_{x \rightarrow 1} F(x) = F(1) = b = 1</math>. Obviously <math>\lim_{x \rightarrow 1^+} F(x) = 1</math>. So looking at the left limit will give us ''k'':
:<math>\lim_{x \rightarrow 1^-} F(x) = \lim_{x \rightarrow 1^-} k \arctan x = k \arctan 1 </math>
Therefore ''k'' = 1/(arctan 1)'', or simply <math>k = \frac4{\pi}</math>.

* Since arctan is non-decreasing, so is ''F''.

'''Hence our final answer is'''

<math>a=0,\quad b=1,\quad k = \frac{4}{\pi}.</math>

:[[File:CDF.png|300px|Note that the cdf is continuous and nondecreasing (the value of F never goes down). It also obeys <math>\lim_{x \rightarrow -\infty} F(x) = 0</math> and <math>\lim_{x \rightarrow \infty} F(x) = 1</math>.]]

''As a remark, it is important to know the exact trig values for special angles. Here: <math>\tan \frac{\pi}{4} = 1</math> so <math>\arctan 1 = \frac{\pi}{4}</math>.''
statement_html:
Consider the function

\[\begin{aligned} F(x) = \begin{cases} a & \text{if } x < 0, \\ k \arctan x & \text{if } 0 \leq x \leq 1, \\ b & \text{if } x \geq 1. \end{cases}\end{aligned}\]

(a) Find the values of a, k and b for which F is a valid cummulative distribution function of a continuous random variable. Then sketch the graph of F.
